org.apache.river.test.impl.end2end.e2etest

Interface UserInterface


  • public interface UserInterface
    An interface which defines the operations which must be supported by a user interface to the test.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean forceFailure()
      Determine whether a failure should be forced when a method call completes.

      Tell the user interface that a remote call has completed

      Tell the user interface that a remote call is in progress

      Set the return status of the remote call

      Set the contextual constraints imposed by the client.

      Set the constraints placed on the proxy by the client.
      void setClientSubject(Subject subject)
      Set the authenticated client subject being used for the remote call

      Set the combined constraints actually being used for the Remote call

      Set the number of endpoints found in a client proxy

      • setTestCount

        void setTestCount(int testNum,
                  int testTotal)
        Set test progress statistics.
        Parameters:
        testNum - the number of the current test
        testTotal - the total number of tests to be run

        Set the free memory which existed immediately after the remote call
        Parameters:
        memory - the amount of free memory

      • setFailureCount

        void setFailureCount(int count)
        Set the number of failures detected for this client
        Parameters:
        count - the number of failures

      • setCallStatus

        void setCallStatus(String message)
        Set the return status of the remote call
        Parameters:
        message - a String describing the return status of the remote call

      • setCallInProgress

        void setCallInProgress()
        Tell the user interface that a remote call is in progress

      • setCallComplete

        void setCallComplete()
        Tell the user interface that a remote call has completed

      • stopAfterCall

        boolean stopAfterCall()
        Determine whether testing should be paused when a method call completes.
        Returns:
        true if testing should pause after a method call completes

      • forceFailure

        boolean forceFailure()
        Determine whether a failure should be forced when a method call completes. Primarily intended for debugging of failure handling
        Returns:
        true of a failure should be forced

      • showFailure

        void showFailure(String message)
        Display a failure indication to the user.
        Parameters:
        message - a String containing the complete failure message to be displayed to the user

      • stopAfterFailure

        boolean stopAfterFailure()
        Determine whether testing should pause after a failure is detected. The UserInterface implementation is free to assume that a failure has occured when this method is called, and may force test termination rather than return. It is expected that 'batch runs' might implement this behavior.
        Returns:
        true if testing should pause on failure
